eventDetailPage.title: African SME Trade & Investment Summit 2025
eventDetailPage.description: Join us for an exclusive event bringing together African SMEs, investors, and industry leaders to explore opportunities for growth and collaboration.
eventDetailPage.longDescription:
The African SME Trade & Investment Summit 2025 is a premier event designed to connect small and medium enterprises across Africa with financing opportunities, capacity-building resources, and market access solutions.

This comprehensive summit will feature keynote presentations from industry leaders, interactive workshops on export strategies, networking sessions with potential partners and investors, and one-on-one consultations with financing intermediaries.

Whether you're looking to expand your business, access new markets, or secure financing for growth, this event provides the platform and resources you need to take your SME to the next level.

capacityBuildingPage.title: Empowering SMEs with Skills
capacityBuildingPage.description: More than training, it’s a strategic investment in African entrepreneurs, equipping them with the skills and confidence to scale, compete globally, and transform local markets into engines of sustainable growth.
capacityBuildingPage.empoweringSme: Empowering SMEs with Skills, Tools, and Opportunities for Growth
capacityBuildingPage.descriptionSME: The Capacity Building component of the Export SME Development Program (ESDP) is designed as an instrument of deliberate investment in the technical, managerial, and operational capacities of African SMEs and their ecosystem enablers. It responds to the manifest need for structured and context-relevant upskilling interventions that transcend generic business training. Programs are delivered in partnership with specialized technical institutions possessing a verifiable record of excellence in enterprise development and sectoral knowledge transfer.

cards.desc1: From agribusiness to tech, SMEs are empowered to scale, innovate, and generate sustainable jobs.
cards.desc2: Banks and investors gain tools to better serve SMEs, ensuring finance flows where it drives real impact.
cards.title3: SME development agencies and business associations
cards.desc3: Business networks and agencies amplify support, building ecosystems where SMEs can thrive.

capacityBuildingPage.trainingAreaDescription: Our performance-based programs focus on seven key competencies to prepare SMEs for local and international expansion:

technicalAssistance.title: Technical Assistance to Financial Intermediaries (TA to FIs)
technicalAssistance.description: We enhance the operational capacity of financial institutions to serve SMEs effectively by improving their end-to-end credit value chains. Focus areas include:
technicalAssistance.feat1: SME banking strategy and product development

incubatorPrograms.title: Incubator Programs
incubatorPrograms.description: Designed for early-stage startups at the ideation or concept stage, incubators provide structured support through:
incubatorPrograms.feat1: Concept validation and business model refinement

acceleratorPrograms.title: Accelerator Programs
acceleratorPrograms.description: Ideal for growth-stage startups with a viable product or early traction, accelerators offer:
acceleratorPrograms.feat3: Market access facilitation and scale-readiness assessments

capacityBuildingPage.workshopDescription1: These short-duration interventions are curated to raise thematic awareness and stimulate dialogue around pressing developmental topics. Unlike the skill-intensive incubators and accelerators, workshops serve to distil knowledge and foster a shared understanding of contextual economic and industrial dynamics.
capacityBuildingPage.workshopDescription2: Events are typically one-day, sector-focused, and aligned with Afreximbank’s overarching mandate of trade-driven development and financial inclusion.

policyAdvocacyPage.title: Unlocking <highlight>SME Potential</highlight> Through Policy Action
policyAdvocacyPage.description: Through the Export SME Development Programme, Afreximbank champions policy reforms that empower SMEs to thrive, fueling innovation, competitiveness, and sustainable growth across Africa.
policyAdvocacyPage.empoweringSme: Advancing the Enabling Environment for SME Development through Strategic Policy Engagement
policyAdvocacyPage.descriptionSME: Within the framework of the Export SME Development Programme (ESDP), Policy Advocacy constitutes a critical pillar through which Afreximbank mobilizes strategic action to reshape the policy landscape underpinning SME performance across the African continent. It recognizes that no entrepreneurial ecosystem can flourish sustainably in the absence of coherent, enabling regulatory structures.
policyAdvocacyPage.pillarDescription: Through this pillar, we seek to :
policyAdvocacyPage.key2: Advance regional integration and intra-African trade
policyAdvocacyPage.key3: Enhance the legitimacy of SME concerns in public discourse
policyAdvocacyPage.key4: Promote socio-economic inclusion via enterprise support
policyAdvocacyPage.coreAdvocDescription: Our advocacy efforts are anchored on evidence-based identification of policy bottlenecks and institutional inefficiencies.
policyAdvocacyPage.coreAdvocDescription2: The focus areas include, but are not limited to:

cards.desc1: Advocating for simplified, progressive tax regimes conducive to SME sustainability
cards.desc2: Strengthening IP protection frameworks to incentivize innovation and safeguard local enterprise
cards.desc3: Engaging policymakers to streamline business registration and compliance processes
cards.desc4: Promoting regional coherence in trade and investment policies
cards.desc5: Facilitating bespoke policy solutions tailored to strategic sectors and industrial clusters

faqPage.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
faqPage.q1: What is the Afreximbank SME Portal?
faqPage.a1: The Afreximbank SME Portal is a one-stop-shop where African & Global African SMEs can access essential information and resources to grow and integrate into regional and global value chain on a sustainable basis.
faqPage.q2: What can an SME or business benefit from the platform?
faqPage.a2: The portal provides enables SMEs and businesses access various opportunities including capacity building and skill development, market access, networking, trade information and financing opportunities under the Afreximbank’ SME Development Programme.
faqPage.q3: How can an SME get maximum value or benefit from the platform?
faqPage.a3: An SME can get maximum value by registering and providing basic Know-Your-Customer (KYC) information, then you are all set!
faqPage.q4: Do I need to pay to have access to resources and other benefits on the portal?
faqPage.a4: Registration on the platform is free and you will have access to many valuable resources and opportunities to expand your business. However, some programmes or resources, including those offered by third parties may be paid for or discounted for your benefit.
faqPage.q5: How do I access financing as an SMEs?
faqPage.a5: Afreximbank extend financing to SMEs through local financial intermediaries (including commercial bank, local and regional development banks, merchant banks, microfinance banks, and other regulated non-bank financial institutions) across Africa and Global Africa . We partner with them to expand our financial interventions and reach to numerous small businesses, including you. You can check the list of financial intermediaries in your country to begin your financing journey.
faqPage.q6: How does Afreximbank define SMEs and those who benefit from your programmes?
faqPage.a6: Though, there are various definitions of SMEs across countries, institutions, and regions. However, Afreximbank holistic definition considers SMEs as businesses with annual revenue not exceeding US$10,000,000 or its equivalent in local currency.
faqPage.a7: Afreximbank SME programme is sector agnostic, but we prioritize the following: Agriculture/Agri-processing, Manufacturing, Technology, Healthcare, Financial services / Fintechs, Creative and Cultural Industries, Logistics, Consumer goods and Retail, Hospitality, Renewable energy, Automotive, Technical, Industrial Education and Ed-Tech.
faqPage.q8: I have heard about the Africa Trade Gateway. Please enlighten me.
faqPage.a8: Africa Trade Gateway (ATG) is a digital “single-window” ecosystem created by Afreximbank and the AfCFTA Secretariat to streamline and boost intra-African trade.It integrates five key platforms; MANSA for business due-diligence, PAPSS for cross-border payments in local currencies, TRADAR for market intelligence and networking, ATEX for B2B digital commerce, and ATG Connect for logistics coordination.Together, these tools reduce connect verified buyers and suppliers across the continent and support the practical implementation of the AfCFTA by reducing friction in trade.
faqPage.q9: What kind of training programmes are offered?
faqPage.a9: A diverse range of capacity-building programmes tailored to support business growth is available through the portal. These include workshops, accelerators, and incubators delivered virtually, in-person, or through hybrid formats. Each programme typically consists of specialized courses that are either sector-focused, country, region, or trade corridor-focused, or designed for specific constituencies such as youth or women.
faqPage.q10: Are courses or webinars available online?
faqPage.a10: Yes, most capacity-building programs—including workshops, accelerators, and incubators—are delivered either virtually or in a hybrid format. The delivery format is always indicated in the call for applications or other communications ahead of time.
faqPage.q11: Do I receive a certificate after completing the training?
faqPage.a11: Yes, certificates are awarded for all capacity-building programs except workshops. Training programs such as accelerators and incubators are certified jointly by Afreximbank and the relevant training partner organization.
